page.title: 10The Bus Service
page.content: There is one bus service through the village, Southdown route 170, and it goes to East Grinstead (46 mins.) and Haywards Heath (17 mins.) It runs every two hours, starting at around 7.30 a.m. The buses do not run on Sundays. The adult fare is about Â£1.20 to Haywards Heath. Many people rely on the bus service for work, shopping and to get to the nearest secondary school. Some people in the village do not use the buses because they think they are not very convenient; the people who do use them often say we need a better service. Some say the buses do not run often enough, that it takes too long for them to get to their destination, or that the last bus leaves too early in the evening. Most local people have their own cars because they do not want to use only the bus service.
